oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Capt. Archibald D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA to his father and friends
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Capt. Archibald D. Norris, Co. K, 7th Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA to his father and friends. He writes of the weather and illnesses among the camps saying that "many of the soldiers had contracted diseases of the chest and lungs such as pleurisy; pneumonia whilst there are some new cases of fever." He asks his father to send him a book, "McCauley's History of England" so that he may study over the winter.
